SEARCH
Package Game

Class RandomPointGenerator

java.lang.Object
Game.RandomPointGenerator
public class RandomPointGenerator extends Object
The RandomPointGenerator class generates random points within specified constraints.

    • RandomPointGenerator

      public RandomPointGenerator(int maxX, int maxY)
      Constructs a new RandomPointGenerator with the specified maximum x and y coordinates.
      Parameters:
      maxX - The maximum x-coordinate.
      maxY - The maximum y-coordinate.

  • Method Details

    • pickRandomPointExcept

      public Point pickRandomPointExcept(List<Entity> existingEntities)
      Picks a random point that doesn't collide with existing entities.
      Parameters:
      existingEntities - The list of existing entities.
      Returns:
      A random point.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If no valid point can be found after the maximum number of attempts.

    • pickRandomPointsExcept

      public List<Point> pickRandomPointsExcept(int numberOfPoints, Rectangle rectangle)
      Picks multiple random points that don't collide with a specified rectangle.
      Parameters:
      numberOfPoints - The number of random points to pick.
      rectangle - The rectangle to avoid collisions with.
      Returns:
      A list of random points.

    • randomizePoint

      private void randomizePoint(Point point)

    • tryRandomizeWithConstraint

      private <TConstraint> Optional<Point> tryRandomizeWithConstraint(TConstraint constraint, BiPredicate<Point,TConstraint> predicate)
      Tries to generate a random point that satisfies the given constraint.
      Type Parameters:
      TConstraint - The type of the constraint.
      Parameters:
      constraint - The constraint to satisfy.
      predicate - The predicate defining the constraint.
      Returns:
      An optional containing the random point if found, or empty if no valid point can be generated.

    • doesntCollideWithEntities

      private boolean doesntCollideWithEntities(Point point, List<Entity> entities)
      Checks if a given point doesn't collide with a list of entities.
      Parameters:
      point - The point to check for collision.
      entities - The list of entities to check against.
      Returns:
      True if the point doesn't collide with any entity, otherwise false.
